messages.content: What is the purpose of the CLIPSeg node in ComfyUI?
The CLIPSeg node in ComfyUI is used to generate a binary mask for a given input image and text prompt, utilizing the CLIPSeg model.
What are the inputs required for the CLIPSeg node?
The inputs required for the CLIPSeg node are: image (a torch.Tensor), text (a string), blur (a float), threshold (a float), and dilation_factor (a float).
What does the blur parameter control in the CLIPSeg node?
The blur parameter in the CLIPSeg node controls the amount of Gaussian blur applied to the generated mask.
What are the outputs of the CLIPSeg node?

The outputs of the CLIPSeg node are: tensor_bw (a torch.Tensor representing the binary mask), image_out_hm (a torch.Tensor representing the heatmap overlay on the input image), and image_out_bw (a torch.Tensor representing the binary mask overlay on the input image).
What is the purpose of the CombineSegMasks node in ComfyUI?
The CombineSegMasks node in ComfyUI is used to combine two or optionally three masks into a single mask to improve masking of different areas.
What are the inputs required for the CombineSegMasks node?
The inputs required for the CombineSegMasks node are: image (a torch.Tensor), mask1 (a torch.Tensor), mask2 (a torch.Tensor), and an optional mask3 (a torch.Tensor, defaults to None).
What are the outputs of the CombineSegMasks node?

The outputs of the CombineSegMasks node are: combined_mask (a torch.Tensor representing the combined mask), image_out_hm (a torch.Tensor representing the heatmap overlay of the combined mask on the input image), and image_out_bw (a torch.Tensor representing the binary mask overlay of the combined mask on the input image).
What are the steps to install and use the CLIPSeg and CombineSegMasks nodes in ComfyUI?

To install and use the CLIPSeg and CombineSegMasks nodes in ComfyUI, follow these steps: 1. Clone the repository or download the source code. 2. Put the clipseg.py file into your custom_nodes directory. 3. Make sure you have the required libraries installed to the venv of ComfyUI.
